citation.article-title: Chryseobacterium soli sp. nov. and Chryseobacterium jejuense sp. nov., isolated from soil samples from Jeju, Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium soli sp. nov.
Chryseobacterium soli (so′li. L. gen. n. soli of soil).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, non-motile, non-endospore-forming, catalase- and oxidase-positive, straight rods (0.6–0.8×1.5–3.0 μm).
Yellow colonies with entire edges are formed on R2A agar plates.
Growth occurs on R2A, trypticase soy agar, nutrient agar (Difco) and MacConkey agar.
Growth occurs at 5–30 °C, the optimum temperature for growth is between 28 and 30 °C.
The pH range for growth is 5.0–9.0, with an optimum between pH 6.0 and 7.0.
Cells grow in the presence of 0–3 % NaCl, but not with 5 % NaCl.
Degrades casein, Tween 80, tyrosine and starch.
Chitin, carboxymethylcellulose, DNA, hypoxanthine, pectin and xanthine are not degraded.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and summed feature 3.
MK-6 is the predominant respiratory quinone.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 39.9 mol%.
The type strain, JS6-6T (=KACC 12502T=DSM 19298T), was isolated from a soil sample from Jeju, Republic of Korea.
